author: djrtwo
content:
we're working on releasing a merge spec *today* for a target testnet at end of month

This should shake out any bugs and final spec changes (hopefully none or minimal) as the testnet runs through the holidays

Assuming we are confident with specs in Jan and assuming Ropsten is planned to be sunset, then merging it in mid-January as a first big testnet merge seems like a reasonable target

If it goes well, great, ropsten will die soon after. If it fails, whoops. If specs change slightly from there, it's okay because ropsten is sunset

author: timbeiko
content: I think we'd want _all_ testnets to transition (or be sunset?) before mainnet. There might be value in keeping one non-PoS one though

author: timbeiko
content: One bit of feedback I've received after London is that it would be nice to scatter the testnet upgrades so that at least one testnet is available as a "staging environment" for mainnet for as long as possible. So it might make sense to transition some testnets early, and some a few weeks before the actual merge.

author: jgm
content:
It may be nice to have a rolling set of testnets, where there is a weekly "pow chain starts, beacon chain starts, merge happens 1 day later" or similar that runs close to the merge date.  For Altair, for example, there were a fair number of beacon client changes made between the last test upgrade and the mainnet upgrade which didn't cause issues, but could have.

(Unless of course there is a real code freeze a decent distance before the merge, but that seems unlikely given past history).
